DataElement.preferredName: Disease Progression During Therapy Treatment Field Inclusion Category
DataElement.preferredDefinition: Term to signify whether disease progression occurred in an area within or outside of a prior treatment field.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A disease process that is increasing in scope or severity._The worsening of a disease over time._At some point in a given period of time._An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: Cancer that continues to grow or spread.

Concepts.definition: A process that manifests as the worsening of a disease over time.

Property.preferredDefinition: At some point in a given period of time.:An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter the course of a pathologic process.

Concepts.definition: At some point in a given period of time.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: the response criteria (includes RECIST and others) and associated documentation of disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: A grouping of items based on some commonality or by user defined characteristics.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Happening or arising or located outside or beyond some limits, or especially, some surface.: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.: The region in which a particular type of force can be observed, often viewed as a space which was modified by the sources of the force which the field represents.

Concepts.definition: An action or administration of therapeutic agents to produce an effect that is intended to alter or stop a pathologic process.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.
